European Commission.Definition: One of the main institutions of the European Union, its job is to represent and uphold the interests of the EU as a whole. It drafts proposals for new European laws. It manages the day-to-day business of implementing EU policies and spending EU funds. The 28 Commissioners, one from each EU member country, provide the Commission's political leadership during their 5-year term. Each Commissioner is assigned responsibility for specific policy areas by the President.The Commission oversees and implements EU policies by:* proposing new laws to Parliament and the Council* managing the EU's budget and allocating funding* enforcing EU law (together with the Court of Justice)* representing the EU internationally, for example, by negotiating agreements between the EU and other countries.The Commission is based in Brussels and Luxembourg and has offices (representations) in every EU country and delegations in capital cities around the world.
